intro: Wurfbainia hedyosma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and thrives in bright, indirect light. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Wurfbainia hedyosma prefers well-draining soil and moderate watering to prevent root rot.
